text: Wrexham Glyndŵr University is a university in Wales. It is named after a Welsh national hero, Owain Glyndŵr. The university opened in 2008. Before becoming a university, it had been the Wrexham School of Arts and Science which opened in 1887. It has over 9000 students, and as well as the Wrexham campus it also has campuses at St. Asaph, Northop, and London. ==References== Category:Universities in the United Kingdom Category:1887 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:1880s establishments in Wales Category:Organisations based in Wales
